main.name: Juan Nathaniel
main.occupation: Software Engineer (occasional Data Scientist) particularly interested in spatial applications
main.bio: I like building softwares and seeing them come to live! Also enjoyed teasing out insights from the massive chaos of big data
main.contactmessage: I'm more than open to collaborate on interesting projects!

resume.skillmessage: Here you can create a short write-up of your skills to show off to employers

education.degree: Bachelor of Environmental Studies (Double Minor in GIS and Economics)
education.description: Exposed and intrigued by the world of geospatial engineering and (vision-based) data science

description.desc: Built geospatial web-apps using MERN stack of web technology
Implemented RESTful APIs using NodeJS, RabbitMQ, web sockets
Deployed CV applications (tree counting, land-use segmentation, aerial facial recognition)
Developed Singapore's historical web-apps using JS/HTML/CSS, NodeJS, leaflet & turfJS
Used Esri's suites of products: ArcGIS API, Esri geodatabase

projects.title: Cloud Instance Segmentation
projects.category: Semantically segment cloud instance using UNet and EfficientNetB2 backbone

projects.title: Reinforcement Learning in Games
projects.category: Collection of intriguing RL models I've built (for training and inference alike)

testimonials.text: Here you should write some nice things that someone has said about you. No lies though, employers can tell when you are lying.

That Tim Baker must be one of the most brilliant developers I've ever met! It is amazing that nobody has hired him yet. Hey you, you should hire this guy, he may be fresh out of University and have zero on the job experience but I am confident that he will be one of your best developers in no time!
